explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy, though the substance contains nitro groups with its oxygen budget calculated at -143.

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains nitro groups with explosive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 47.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen and fluorine (but not chlorine), with the oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the substances with melting points of <55degC (melting point: 47.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,517mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >2.8mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation, which were fully reversed within 14 days, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation of the eye, which persisted for up to day 7, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989, 1997)) and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1997)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In single dose toxicity studies, the test animals demonstrated "lacrimation," "salivation," "blepharoptosis," "convulsions" and "spastic gait" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)) indicative of nervous system effects. However, it was decided not to use these findings for classification since the exposure doses exceeded the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50<=5microg/L of the fish (Atlantic Clupea pallasii) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since the acute toxicity was Category 1 and it had no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 4% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and it had the bio-accumulation (BCF=945 (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
